intro: Alsophila hebes, commonly known as the dwarf tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright trunk and feathery fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 3 meters in optimal conditions. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, supporting the growth of its distinctive crown of pinnate leaves. Alsophila hebes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens and as a houseplant.
